title: Labour to confirm dropping £28bn a year green investment pledge
description: Labour will confirm it is dropping a pledge to spend £28bn a year on green investment if it enters government, following weeks of confusion about the flagship policy. Sir Keir Starmer had originally promised in 2021 to invest £28bn annually until 2030 on green projects if Labour came to power.

title: Labour ditches £28bn green investment pledge
description: Labour is ditching its policy of spending £28bn a year on its green investment plan in a major U-turn, sources have told the BBC. An official announcement will be made on Thursday. The sources insist the party's Green Prosperity Plan, which includes creating a publicly-owned green power firm, is not being dropped altogether.

title: Labour set to ditch target to spend £28bn a year on green investment
description: Starmer is poised to use a set piece event to drop the £28bn figure from Labour’s “green prosperity plan”, blaming the worsening public finances under the Conservative government. “There will be an announcement tomorrow,” said a Labour spokesperson.

description: Labour will announce tomorrow that it is scaling back its flagship green prosperity plan, Sky News understands.

title: DUP fails to block Irish language sign in south Belfast after residents split over proposal
description: The DUP has failed to block an Irish language street sign being approved in south Belfast, after a consultation showed a 50-50 split between residents over the new sign.

title: Keir Starmer set to abandon £28 billion green investment pledge
description: Sir Keir Starmer is set to formally abandon his £28 billion green investment pledge on Thursday, arguing that Labour can no longer promise to borrow that amount a year.

title: Sir Keir Starmer expected to confirm scaling back of £28bn green pledge

title: Row erupts over cost of Labour's home insulation plan
description: Labour has rejected as "bogus" an analysis by government officials that its plan to improve home energy efficiency would cost £12-15bn a year. The party has said the measures, part of a wider £28bn green investment plan, would be capped at £6bn a year.
